page.title: 12ATTITUDES OF ARBROATH FOLK 1
page.content: We surveyed a number of the { {population }who stayed in our area.The first two questions showed that quite a lot of them wanted the range of goods in the local shops to improve. Some thought the local{traders}charged too much.Among suggestions for improvement were a more personal approach,greater variety of shops,and more modern shops.Most people said they liked the area.Reasons given were the {community}atmosphere,the range of clubs and organised groups,the countryside and seaside close by,the climate,even in one case the copper beech trees which grew in the street.Improvements suggested included more play areas for children, a decent public{transport}service,more public toilets,beach amenity improv- ements,and,most of all a change from t he one way traffic system in Arbroath.
